I dont know how they will change how you handle your taxes. For a small llc you do your txes on your regular tax form and profit is treated like 1099 income.
If you have an S Corporation or an LlC that you opt to be taxed like an S Corporation, you also fill out a corporate tax form and send that in. You dont pay taxes against this. Its just where you put your revenues and expenses. I use turbo tax business to do this. It gives you a profit or loss. You put that number on your regular returns. I again do this with the turbo tax personal. So I need 2 versions of turbotax. Fir an S corp you also pay yourself a regular w-2 salary. That income is put on your tax form as regular taxes just like if you had a regular employer. The profit/loss after that is put on the form differently. The tax difference being that any profit above w-2 income does not have social security or medicare tax.
I dont know how they would change the tax forms. The simplest is you keep the pass through entity the same and the money that goes on your regular tax form as profit is taxed at 15%.
You will see executives in every corporation create business to lower their taxes.

At 234 lbs isnt that small to block as a TE? He would have to put on 10-15 pounds to be an effective blocker. If he does that he will slow. The other issue at 234 lbs is getting off the line from a down position. At his size linebackers can bump him and that is all it takes to disrupt a pattern. NFL LBs and DEs are alot bigger than in college.
I think one of two things will happen.
1. If he turns out to be a really good receiver they will transition him more to a big WR and he will move to the outside. Not this year as long as Brandon Marshall is healthy. They will stand him up more and spread him out more to get him a free release. If he does this they might have him lose a little wait to improve his speed.
2. They will have him bulk up some so he can block. He will lose some speed, but to be a full time TE you gotta block and you gotta be able to get off the line from a down position. He could still be a good receiver matching up on LBs and safeties, but he would lose a step if he added bulk.
This assumes he is good and not yet another tweener who doesnt have a pro position. I hope the scouting is good on him. This year expect them to have him stay the same size and have him focus on the pro game and see how he does.

The conservatives are from rock solid republican districts. They will not face a serious democratic challenge. The moderates tend to be from swing districts and will face a serious democratic challenge. From a keep republicans in the majority standpoint, conservatives compromising have less risk then moderates. Now some conservatives may face a primary challenge, but that isnt as dangerous as someone in a swing district facing a tough democrat. Incumbents rarely lose primary challenges. There was one in 2014 in virginia, but we remember it because it was rare. I live near there. He lost more because he was an asshole who didnt go back to his district enough than because he wasnt conservative enough even though the challenge was from the right. He seriously blew off the district and didnt see constituents. Guy was an idiot.
Conservatives should be able to sell, if I dont compromise we are stuck with Obamacare permanently and we will likely lose the house. They have to hold out fir a while. Maybe later in the year they can compromise?
If they dont they wont get anything. I wonder if Trump would work with democrats after that to reform Obamacare instead? Two issues with that. Trump is a lying prick. So democrats have no incentive to work with him and compromise other than Obamacare needs reform. I want it to stay, but it needs to be changed. Its a good first step. Trump would have to go pretty far left to get enough democrats and republicans on board to do this.
He could then take credit for being a good compromiser. I think his base rural poor supporters are not conservatives. They need the healthcare. Alot dont get the medicaid benefits from Obamacare because they are in red states so they dint know what they are missing.
I am really curious how Trump will respond if he cant get conservatives to compromise by early next year. If Trump cant reform healthcare there will be a massive democratic pickup in 2018. If he compromises, democrats will still pick up seats, but republicans in swing districts can say they voted to fix Obamacare.

WRITING.TITLE: What is the penalty on a former US military person who accepts payments from a foreign government?
WRITING.TEXT:
The reporting on the Michael Flynn foreign payments has been choppy and not very detailed. The best I found is the Washington Post article I am linking below. This is a combination question/commentary for discussion.
The implication of the article is that this is a civil and not criminal issue. The article mentions that a debt collector may come after him for the money he was paid by Russia.This isn't clear, but a debt collector cannot impose fines. Only a court can. So it sounds like the worst that can happen is that Flynn will lose the money he was paid. Anyone else know more? Seriously really weak reporting. They should lay out the penalties better.
This is a totally separate issue from Flynn lying on his security clearance form. I have filled security clearance applications before. That is a felony and that would involve the Justice department. This question is strictly about the defense department restricting payments from foreign powers to former US military.
If the only penalty for this is we seize your money, there is no reason to comply. Ignore it. Try to get away with it. Worst case government makes you give them the money. Take the cash, put it in a bond. At worst you get some interest. Given that this only came out because he was National Security Advisor, it makes me wonder whether many other former military take these payments.
Mods: please keep the discussion on the topic of the military going after someones momey. The penalties for lying on a security clearance form can be easily googled.
https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/checkpoint/wp/2017/04/27/top-pentagon-watchdog-launches-investigation-into-money-that-mike-flynn-received-from-foreign-groups/?hpid=hp_rhp-top-table-main_flynn-1105a%3Ahomepage%2Fstory utm_term=.f613946d18b5
